itemDescription: British music hall comedian, song writer, recording artist and theatrical producer

wikipedia_page.main: Herbert Darnley (12 May 1872 – 1947), real name Herbert Walter McCarthy, was a British music hall comedian, song writer, popular early recording artist and theatrical producer, active from the 1890s until the early 1940s, who claimed descent from Edmund Kean.

link_mentions.page: List of musicals by composer: A to L
response: ::     Mr. Wix of Wickham (1902); music also by Herbert Darnley; 1904 Broadway version with additional songs by Jerome Kern
::     Mr. Wix of Wickham (1904); 1902 West End version with music by Herbert Darnley, George Everard

link_mentions.page: List of songs recorded by Ringo Starr

response: Later in 1929, she obtained the lead in By Whose Hand? by the British music hall comedian and theatrical impresario Herbert Darnley, a murder story that was staged at the Pavilion Theatre in Leicester. Darnley gave a speech in which he said he was pleased to remove Dolores from the "human wolves" of London who "were trying to tear her to pieces.""A Suicide Club That Made London Gasp", Miami Daily News, 21 April 1929, p. 9. She held the role for over six months and the production took in Mexborough and the Theatre Royal, Sheffield.
